description.para: Bit masks for the frame_control field of a ZCL header (zcl_header_t, zcl_header_response_t, zcl_header_withmfg_t, or zcl_header_nomfg_t)

briefdescription.para: Bits of frame type.
cmd acts across entire profile
cmd is specific to a cluster
mfg code field not present
mfg code field present
direction bit
cmd sent from client to server
cmd sent from server to client
default response only on error
should be set to 0

description.para: Note that these defines use the exact names from the ZCL standard, with ZCL_STATUS_ prepended.
Used for the .command element of the ZCL header.
Command IDs 0x11 to 0x7F (Standard ZigBee command) and 0x80 to 0xFF are reserved.

simplesect.para: Only supported commands are currently documented.

briefdescription.para: Read Attributes Command, payload is 1 to n 2-byte attribute IDs.
Read Attributes Response Command, payload is 1 to n variable-length Read Attribute Status records (zcl_rec_read_attrib_status_t).
Write Attributes Command, payload is 1 to n variable-length Write Attribute Record fields (same as zcl_attrib_t).
Write Attributes Undivided Command, same payload as Write Attributes Command (zcl_attrib_t), but attributes are only written if all attributes can be written successfully.

Write Attributes Response Command, payload is a single byte (ZCL_STATUS_SUCCESS) if all writes were successful or 1 to n 3-byte Write Attribute Status records (zcl_rec_write_attrib_status_t) for each write that failed.
Write Attributes No Response Command, same payload as Write Attributes Command (ZCL_CMD_WRITE_ATTRIB), handled as a Write Attributes Command except the response is not sent.
Default Response Command, payload is 2 bytes; Command ID and Status Code (zcl_default_response_t).
Discover Attributes Command, payload is 3 bytes; start attribute ID and maximum number of attributes to return (zcl_discover_attrib_t).

Discover Attributes Response Command payload is a "discovery complete" byte (done = ZCL_BOOL_TRUE, more attributes = ZCL_BOOL_TRUE), followed by 1 to n 3-byte Attribute Report fields (zcl_rec_attrib_report_t).

description.para: Values for flags element of zcl_attribute_base_t.

briefdescription.para: Data is stored as sent/received in ZCL requests (little-endian, 24-bit types stored as 3 bytes instead of 4).

detaileddescription.para: Not applicable to string types.

briefdescription.para: If set, this is part of a zcl_attribute_full_t structure.
Common portion of ZCL header (appears after optional Manufacturer Code)
General header for casting onto an incoming frame.

detaileddescription.para: Reference .type.mfg if (.frame_control & ZCL_FRAME_MFG_SPECIFIC != 0). Reference .type.std otherwise.

memberdef.name: zcl_header_response_t

briefdescription.para: ZCL header structure used for building response frames that may or may not be manufacturer-specific.

detaileddescription.para: Frame is sent starting with element .u.mfg.frame_control or .u.std.frame_control.

briefdescription.para: ZLC header structure used when building a manufacturer-specific response frame.
ZLC header structure used when building a normal (non-manufacturer-specific response frame.
General format for an attribute, used for Write Attributes and Report Attributes commands.
Used for ZCL_CMD_READ_ATTRIB_RESP.
Used for ZCL_CMD_WRITE_ATTRIB_RESP.
Used for ZCL_CMD_DEFAULT_RESP.
Used for ZCL_CMD_DISCOVER_ATTRIB.
Used for ZCL_CMD_DISCOVER_ATTRIB_RESP.
Used for ZCL_CMD_DISCOVER_ATTRIB_RESP.

memberdef.definition: typedef uint_fast8_t(* zcl_attribute_update_fn) (const struct zcl_attribute_full_t FAR *entry)
memberdef.name: zcl_attribute_update_fn

briefdescription.para: Function pointer assigned to a ZCL attribute record, called to update the value of the given attribute.

detaileddescription.para: Necessary for attributes that are tied to physical hardware (only updated when requested) or attributes that change over time (as with the ZCL Identify cluster).
If the return value is not ZCL_STATUS_SUCCESS, the ZCL Read Attributes handler will return that as an error in the response frame.

parameterdescription.para: unable to update value due to hardware problem
unable to update value due to software problem

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* zcl_attribute_write_fn) (const struct zcl_attribute_full_t FAR *entry, zcl_attribute_write_rec_t *rec)
memberdef.name: zcl_attribute_write_fn

briefdescription.para: Function pointer assigned to a ZCL attribute record, called instead of zcl_decode_attribute() to process a Write Request for the attribute.

detaileddescription.para: This function typically calls zcl_decode_attribute() to convert the request to a temporary variable and then perform additional checks on it before assigning to the actual variable.

parameterdescription.para: record from Write Request with new value

simplesect.para: number of bytes consumed from Write Request

briefdescription.para: If a cluster doesn't have attributes, use zcl_attributes_none (a single, empty attribute list) in the cluster definition.

detaileddescription.para: Don't use NULL, since the APS dispatcher will use endpoint's context if the cluster's context is NULL.

briefdescription.para: first byte of variable-length field
manufacturer-specific extension
manufacturer-specific extension
standard
standard
see zigbee/zcl_types.h

detaileddescription.para: always ZCL_TYPE_STRUCT
one of ZCL_TYPE_ARRAY, ZCL_TYPE_SET, ZCL_TYPE_BAG
only included if status == ZCL_STATUS_SUCCESS

briefdescription.para: variable length, depending on type

detaileddescription.para: variable length, only if ZCL_STATUS_SUCCESS

briefdescription.para: number of elements to follow
mult. uint8_t type and variable-length value
Source data to write to attribute.
Number of bytes in buffer.
Parsing flags (see ZCL_ATTR_WRITE_FLAG_* macros for valid flags).
Set to #ZCL_STATUS_SUCCESS if data is valid, or some other ZCL_STATUS_* macro if there's an error.
The ZCL Attribute Type, should be one of the ZCL_TYPE_* macros defined in zigbee/zcl_types.h.
Pointer to global variable of correct type, set as const to allow for both const and non-const values.

detaileddescription.para: (If const, flags should be include #ZCL_ATTRIB_FLAG_READONLY.) If NULL, the ZCL stack will respond to attempts to read/write with ZCL_STATUS_DEFINED_OUT_OF_BAND.

briefdescription.para: Minimum value for attribute (currently unused until I pick a value to represent "none").
Maximum value for attribute, assumes 32-bit limit.

detaileddescription.para: For string attributes, the maximum length that can be stored at value.

briefdescription.para: On an attribute read, the ZCL dispatcher will call the .read function to refresh the attribute's value before responding to the request.

detaileddescription.para: Do I need a return value in the function to pass an error up?

briefdescription.para: On an attribute write, the ZCL dispatcher will call the .write function with a structure containing information about the write request.

detaileddescription.para: See the documentation for zcl_attribute_write_fn() for the API, and the Time and Identify clusters for examples of its use.

briefdescription.para: maximum number of elements to store
current number of elements
number of bytes in each element
type of data stored in array
ZCL data type of element.
offset into structure
number of elements in structure
base address of structure
elements in the structure
ID for manufacturer-specific attributes or ZCL_MFG_NONE if general.
List of attributes for the SERVER cluster (or NULL if none).
List of attributes for the CLIENT cluster (or NULL if none).
If a cluster doesn't have attributes, use zcl_attributes_none (a single, empty attribute list) in the cluster definition.

detaileddescription.para: Don't use NULL, since the APS dispatcher will use endpoint's context if the cluster's context is NULL.

briefdescription.para: envelope for the received command, envelope's payload and length include the ZCL header
frame control byte from the ZCL header
manufacturer code from the ZCL header, in host byte order, or 0x0000 if not mfg specific
sequence byte from the ZCL header
command byte from the ZCL header
Appropriate list of attributes on this device, related to the command.

detaileddescription.para: Based on the direction bit from frame_control and the mfg_code field.

briefdescription.para: pointer to the ZCL payload (first byte after ZCL header)
length of the ZCL payload
Send a response to a ZCL command.

detaileddescription.para: Uses information from the command received to populate fields in the response.

briefdescription.para: Return a pointer to the next attribute entry from an attribute table.

simplesect.para: If entry points to the last entry in the table, this function will return the same address instead of advancing off the end of the table.

briefdescription.para: Search the attribute table starting at entry, for attribute ID search_id.

parameterdescription.para: attribute id search_id not in list

briefdescription.para: Support function to fill in a ZCL response header.

detaileddescription.para: Set the frame_control, sequence and optional mfg_code fields of the ZCL response header, and return the offset to the actual start of the header (non-mfg specific skips the first two bytes).

parameterdescription.para: buffer to store header of response

briefdescription.para: Send a Default Response (ZCL_CMD_DEFAULT_RESP) to a given command.

parameterdescription.para: status to use in the response (see ZCL_STATUS_* macros under "ZCL Status Enumerations" in zigbee/zcl.h)
successfully sent response, or response not required (message was broadcast, sent to the broadcast endpoint, or sender set the disable default response bit)

briefdescription.para: Checks whether a new value from a Write Attributes command is within the limits specified for a given attribute.

parameterdescription.para: entry to use for min/max check
buffer with new value (in little-endian byte order), from write attributes command
new value is within range (or attribute doesn't have a min/max)

briefdescription.para: Parse an attribute record from a Write Attributes Request or a Read Attributes Response and possibly store the new attribute value.

detaileddescription.para: If ZCL_ATTR_WRITE_FLAG_READ_RESP is set in write_rec->flags, write_rec->buffer will be parsed as a Read Attributes Response record. Otherwise, it's parsed as a Write Attributes Request record.

parameterdescription.para: attribute table to search or NULL if there aren't any attributes on this cluster
state information for parsing write request
number of bytes consumed from buffer

xrefdescription.para: should we set a flag in write_rec to indicate that the status was not success?

briefdescription.para: Convert a 24-bit (3-byte) little-endian value to a 32-bit value in host byte order.

parameterdescription.para: if TRUE, set high byte of result to 0xFF if top bit of 24-bit value is set

simplesect.para: A 32-bit, host-byte-order version of the 24-bit, little-endian value passed in.

briefdescription.para: Decode attribute value from a Write Attribute Request or Read Attribute Response record and optionally write to entry.

parameterdescription.para: state information for parsing write request
number of bytes consumed from rec->buffer

briefdescription.para: Process the three types of Write Attributes requests.

internal.para: Handles Write Attributes (ZCL_CMD_WRITE_ATTRIB), Write Attributes Undivided (ZCL_CMD_WRITE_ATTRIB_UNDIV) and Write Attributes No Response (ZCL_CMD_WRITE_ATTRIB_NORESP).

parameterdescription.para: successfully sent response or "No Response" requested

xrefdescription.para: Generate error if command is not one of the three expected commands.
Update to limit number of status records in response.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t FAR *buffer, int16_t bufsize, const zcl_struct_t FAR *zcl_struct)
memberdef.name: _zcl_encode_struct_value

briefdescription.para: Format a ZCL struct for a Read Attributes Response or a Write Attributes Request.

internal.para:
buffer
buffer to store encoded attribute
bufsize
number of bytes available in buffer
zcl_struct
struct to encode into buffer
Copies the value of attribute entry to buffer in little-endian byte order. Will not write more than bufsize bytes. Used to build ZCL frames.

parameterdescription.para: buffer too small to encode value

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t FAR *buffer, int16_t bufsize, const zcl_attribute_base_t FAR *entry)
memberdef.name: zcl_encode_attribute_value

briefdescription.para: Format a ZCL attribute's value for a Read Attributes Response or a Write Attributes Request.

detaileddescription.para: Copies the value of attribute entry to buffer in little-endian byte order. Will not write more than bufsize bytes. Used to build ZCL frames.

parameterdescription.para: number of bytes available in buffer
buffer too small to encode value

briefdescription.para: Process the Read Attributes Command (ZCL_CMD_READ_ATTRIB).
Process the Discover Attributes Command (ZCL_CMD_DISCOVER_ATTRIB).
Parse a ZCL request and store in a zcl_command_t structure with fields in fixed locations (therefore easier to use than the variable-length frame header).

detaileddescription.para: Also uses the direction bit and manufacturer ID to search the attribute tree for the correct list of attributes.

parameterdescription.para: buffer to store parsed ZCL command
pointer to attribute tree for cluster or NULL if the cluster doesn't have any attributes (typically passed in via endpoint dispatcher)
parsed payload from envelope into cmd
frame is too small for ZCL header's frame_control value

briefdescription.para: Debugging routine that dumps contents of a parsed ZCL command structure to STDOUT.
Debugging routine that parses an envelope payload as a ZCL command and dumps a parsed copy to STDOUT.

parameterdescription.para: wpan_envelope_t structure with a ZCL command payload

briefdescription.para: Called if a request comes in for an invalid endpoint/cluster combination.

detaileddescription.para: Sends a Default Response (ZCL_CMD_DEFAULT_RESP) of #ZCL_STATUS_FAILURE unless the received command was a Default Response or was broadcast.

parameterdescription.para: command was a default response (and therefore ignored), or a default response was successfully sent

briefdescription.para: Called if a request comes in for an invalid command on a valid endpoint/cluster combination.

detaileddescription.para:
Sends a Default Response (ZCL_CMD_DEFAULT_RESP) unless the received command was a Default Response or was broadcast. Depending on the command received, the response will be one of:
ZCL_STATUS_UNSUP_CLUSTER_COMMAND
ZCL_STATUS_UNSUP_GENERAL_COMMAND
ZCL_STATUS_UNSUP_MANUF_CLUSTER_COMMAND
ZCL_STATUS_UNSUP_MANUF_GENERAL_COMMAND

parameterdescription.para: default response was successfully sent, or command did not require a default response

briefdescription.para: Handler for ZCL General Commands.

detaileddescription.para: Used as the handler for attribute-only clusters (e.g., Basic Cluster), or called from a cluster's handler for commands it doesn't handle.
Will send a Default Response for commands it can't handle.
Currently does not support attribute reporting.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to attribute tree for cluster or NULL if the cluster doesn't have any attributes (typically passed in via endpoint dispatcher)
command was processed, including sending a possible response
error sending response or processing command

briefdescription.para: Converts a ZCL status byte (one of the ZCL_STATUS_* macros) into a string.

simplesect.para: pointer to an unmodifiable string with a description of the status

memberdef.name: ZCL_CMD_MATCH
memberdef.initializer: ((*(const uint8_t FAR *)(p) & \ (ZCL_FRAME_MFG_SPECIFIC | ZCL_FRAME_DIRECTION | ZCL_FRAME_TYPE_MASK)) == \ (ZCL_FRAME_ ## mfg | ZCL_FRAME_ ## dir | ZCL_FRAME_TYPE_ ## type))

briefdescription.para: Macro for checking the frame control field of a ZCL command.

detaileddescription.para: Used to filter out commands that are (or are not) handled by the current function.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to first byte of payload (typically envelope->payload when called from a standard ZCL command handler, or the address of frame_control from a zcl_command_t built with zcl_command_build)
either PROFILE (e.g., general commands) or CLUSTER (cluster-specific command)
ZCL command matches all three filters

briefdescription.para: Identify profile commands (as opposed to cluster commands) using the frame control field of a ZCL command.

detaileddescription.para: Ignores the manufacturer-specific bit (which specifies use of manufacturer-specific attributes).

parameterdescription.para: pointer to first byte of payload
ZCL command is not cluster-specific (profile command)

briefdescription.para: Identify manufacturer-specific cluster commands using the frame control field of a ZCL command.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to first byte of payload
ZCL command is manufacturer and cluster-specific
ZCL command doesn't have the manufacturer-specific bit set, or is a profile-wide command

briefdescription.para: Identify cluster commands that are not manufacturer-specific, using the frame control field of a ZCL command.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to first byte of payload
ZCL command is manufacturer and cluster-specific
ZCL command doesn't have the manufacturer-specific bit set, or is a profile-wide command

briefdescription.para: Assign the new value to the attribute (if not set, just checks the validity of the data).
Parsing a Write Attribute Request record.
Parsing a Read Attribute Response record.
Attribute ID for end of list marker.
